me.cassayre.florian.hawk

Class ReportsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zcraft.quartzlib.core.QuartzComponent
      • me.cassayre.florian.hawk.ReportsManager

  • public class ReportsManager
extends fr.zcraft.quartzlib.core.QuartzComponent
    The reports manager: registers, saves, manages export & backups of, all reports.

    If you use this without the plugin, by shading the library, you must initialize the manager first: 

         ReportsManager.init(yourPluginInstance);
     final ReportsManager manager = ReportsManager.get();

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin plugin)
        Initialize the reports manager for use as a shaded library.

        If you're depending on this by requiring the Hawk plugin to be installed on the server, you don't need this. Use this method to get the manager.

        Parameters:
        plugin - Your plugin's instance.

      • get

        public static ReportsManager get()
        Retrieves the Reports Manager instance.
        Returns:
        the unique instance.

      • onEnable

        protected void onEnable()
        Overrides:
        onEnable in class fr.zcraft.quartzlib.core.QuartzComponent

      • setBackup

        public void setBackup(boolean backup)
        Enables or disables reports backups.

        If enabled, every minute by default, all running reports will be saved into a backup directory, this directory being reports/backup under your plugin's data directory (or Hawk's own data directory, if used not shaded).

        Parameters:
        backup - true to enable backups.
        See Also:
        to change the backup interval.

      • setBackupInterval

        public void setBackupInterval(long backupInterval)
        Changes the backups interval. By default, a backup is made every minute.
        Parameters:
        backupInterval - The backup interval, in ticks.

      • setRemoteInstanceURL

        public void setRemoteInstanceURL(String remoteInstanceURL)
        Sets the remote instance URL. This must point to the base URL of a website running the Hawk GUI, or another with a compatible API. Published reports will be sent to this website.

        The default value is the main instance managed by us (Hawk authors).

        Parameters:
        remoteInstanceURL - The URL.

      • setSaveDirectory

        public void setSaveDirectory(File saveDirectory)

        Sets the directory where the reports & reports backups wll be saved by default.

        Reports saved using the save method will be saved directly into this directory, and backups (saved using the backup method will be saved under a backups sub-directory.

        By default, this directory is a reports sub-directory of your plugin's data folder (if used shaded) or Hawk's data folder (if used by requiring the Hawk plugin to be installed by the users).

        Parameters:
        saveDirectory - The new directory.

      • registerReport

        public Report registerReport(Report report)
        Registers a report into this manager. If you use auto-track, you _must_ register the report for damages, heals and event to be saved. Also, only registered reports will have backups.
        Parameters:
        report - The report to register.
        Returns:
        The registered report (so you can reuse it in chains).

      • unregisterReport

        public Report unregisterReport(Report report)
        Unregisters a report.

        This implies that auto-track will no longer be active, and backups will stop for this report. You'll still be able to save, publish, or event backup manually the report using the methods in this class.

        Parameters:
        report - The report to unregister.
        Returns:
        The registered report (so you can reuse it in chains).

      • getTrackedReportsFor

        public Stream<Report> getTrackedReportsFor(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player)
        Gets all reports containing the given player, with auto-track enabled, and with the given player into the track list.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        Returns:
        A stream of reports.
        See Also:
        Option to include non- tracked players.

      • getTrackedReportsFor

        public Stream<Report> getTrackedReportsFor(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player,
                                           boolean includeReportsWerePlayerIsNotTracked)
        Gets all reports containing the given player, with auto-track enabled.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        includeReportsWerePlayerIsNotTracked - If true, reports containing the given player but where this player is not tracked will be included.
        Returns:
        A stream of reports.

      • backup

        public void backup(Report report,
                   fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.Callback<File> callbackSuccess,
                   fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.Callback<Throwable> callbackError)
        Backups this report.

        The backup will be saved to reports/backups in your plugin's data directory (or Hawk's one if used non-shaded).

        The backup is automatic by default. Only use this method if you want to manually backup the report.

        Parameters:
        report - The report to backup.
        callbackSuccess - Called on success, the argument being the file where the report's backup was saved into.
        callbackError - Called on error, the argument being the exception.

      • save

        public void save(Report report,
                 fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.Callback<File> callbackSuccess,
                 fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.Callback<Throwable> callbackError)
        Saves this report as JSON.

        The report will be saved in your plugin's data directory, under reports/yyyy-mm-dd-hh-mm-ss-title-as-slug.json.

        Parameters:
        report - The report.
        callbackSuccess - Callback for success, the argument being the file where the report was saved.
        callbackError - Callback for error. Contains the exception.
        See Also:
        to save to a specific location.

      • save

        public void save(Report report,
                 File location,
                 fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.Callback<File> callbackSuccess,
                 fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.Callback<Throwable> callbackError)
        Saves the given report as JSON.
        Parameters:
        report - The report.
        location - The location where this report should be saved.
        callbackSuccess - Callback on success, the argument being the file where the report was saved.
        callbackError - Callback on error, the argument being the exception.
        See Also:
        to save using the default location.

      • publish

        public void publish(Report report,
                    fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.Callback<URI> callbackSuccess,
                    fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.Callback<Throwable> callbackError)
        Publish the given report into a user-friendly web page.
        Parameters:
        report - The report.
        callbackSuccess - Callback on success, the argument being the published report full URL.
        callbackError - Callback on error, the argument being the error returned.

      • _setLastHealingType

        public HealRecord.HealingType _setLastHealingType(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                                  HealRecord.HealingType healingType)
        Saves the last healing type for the given player. Internal use but must be public.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        healingType - The healing type.
        Returns:
        The given healing, for chaining.

      • _getLastHealingType

        public HealRecord.HealingType _getLastHealingType(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Retrieves the last healing type for the given player. Internal use but must be public.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        Returns:
        The latest recorded healing type with #_setLastHealingType(Player, HealingType), or HealRecord.HealingType.UNKNOWN if nothing recorded.

      • _setLastMagicDamage

        public DamageRecord _setLastMagicDamage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                        DamageRecord damage)
        Saves the last magic damage for the given player. Internal use but must be public.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        damage - The damage.
        Returns:
        The given damage, for chaining.

      • _getLastMagicDamage

        public DamageRecord _getLastMagicDamage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Retrieves the last magic damage for the given player. Internal use but must be public.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        Returns:
        The latest recorded damage with _setLastMagicDamage(Player, DamageRecord), or null if nothing recorded.
